item.title: Sharon add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Once you learn to read, you will be forever free." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Austin Phelps
item.description: "Wear the old coat and buy the new book." -- Austin Phelps

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "The ability to read awoke inside of me some long dormant craving to be mentally alive." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "Reading without reflecting is like eating without digesting." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Sharon add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "We love the things we love for what they are." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sharon add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Sharon add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best day and night to make you like everybody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight and never stop fighting." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Poetry is what gets lost in translation." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Sharon add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Dogs are better than human beings because they know but do not tell." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Music is the universal language of mankind." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Listen--are you breathing just a little, and calling it a life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Watch out for intellect, because it knows so much it knows nothing and leaves you hanging upside down, mouthing knowledge as your heart falls out of your mouth." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Sharon add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Genuine poetry can communicate before it is understood." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The poet knows that he speaks adequately, then, only when he speaks somewhat wildly." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Poetry makes life what lights and music do the stage." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "Poetry is not the most important thing in life... I'd much rather lie in a hot bath reading Agatha Christie and sucking sweets." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Robert Haas
item.description: "A word is elegy to what it signifies." -- Robert Haas

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I act as the tongue of you, ... tied in your mouth . . . . in mine it begins to be loosened." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Frank O'Hara
item.description:
"My Heart
I'm not going to cry all the time nor shall I laugh all the time, I don't prefer one "strain" to another. I'd have the immediacy of a bad movie, not just a sleeper, but also the big, overproduced first-run kind. I want to be at least as alive as the vulgar. And if some aficionado of my mess says "That's not like Frank!," all to the good! I don't wear brown and grey suits all the time, do I? No. I wear workshirts to the opera, often. I want my feet to be bare, I want my face to be shaven, and my heart--you can't plan on the heart, but the better part of it, my poetry, is open." -- Frank O'Hara

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Paul Valery
item.description: "Poems are never finished - just abandoned" -- Paul Valery

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Don't use the phone. People are never ready to answer it. Use poetry." -- Jack Kerouac
